oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Gretchen Peters - 2018-05-21
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Gretchen Peters and Barry Walsh from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 21, 2018. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Gretchen Peters; Barry Walsh;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments by Kayleigh Shoemaker and introduction of Gretchen and pianist Barry Walsh / (03:33) Opening comments by Gretchen / (03:56) Performs When All You Got Is A Hammer / (07:42) Thanks the audience / (07:59) Performs The Matador / (12:51) Introduces the next song / (13:44) Performs Disappearing Act (with Lisa Oliver on vocals) / (18:11) Introduces the next song / (18:53) Performs Arguing With Ghosts / (22:46) Introduces Barry Walsh and then introduces the next song / (23:47) Performs Blackbirds / (28:33) Introduces the next song / (29:11) Performs Independence Day / (33:52) Answers question about her favorite country singer and talks about Mickey Newbury and her favorite new country artists / (35:52) Answers question about co-writing and doing lyrics or music first / (36:49) Answers question about inspiration / (38:28) Answers question about writing the song Independence Day / (39:17) Closing comments / (39:27) Introduces the next song / (39:48) Performs Wichita / (43:55) Final comments / (44:13) Walk-out Music / (46:19) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:format: original source recorded as an mp3 file at 44.1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Peters, Gretchen; Walsh, Barry; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
